intro: Cacalia adscendens, commonly known as the ascending cacalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Cacalia adscendens is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe and Asia.
